intro: Eutriana karwinskiana, commonly known as the Karwinskiana spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Eutriana karwinskiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
